avalancheActivity.comment: No new avalanches have been recorded in the area since before the Eastern weekend. On 26.3 a size 2 avalanches fell in Eldborgargil in Bláfjöll.  Hikers triggered two smaller slab avalanches in the area the same day.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Potentially unstable windslabs, especially in W-aspects. No avalanches recorded since last week.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Windslabs in westerly aspects due to snowfall the week before last week and then snowdrift in easterly winds. These windslabs can be tricky in steep slopes. In some places the wind has moved the new snow, leaving only the old, hard snow. A weak faceted layer was spotted in a snowpit on March 26th.

travelAdvisory.comment: Heavy snowdrift in strong NE-winds many places the last days and alot of snow added at higher elevations in the Eastfjords and invalley in the northern part. Wind slabs are unstable many places and avalanches have released the last days. Today a slab overran the main road in Hestfjörður in Ísafjarðardjúp and a small slab was triggered by skiers in Böggvisstaðafjall above Dalvík. Several slabs were spotted between snowshowers in Tröllaskagi today which most likely have released in the blizzard yeasterday when two avalanches closed the roads there. In the Eastfjords the sight has been bad for observations but at least one slab was spotted west of the Eskifjörður village. The last days more avalanches have fallen, both human- and naturally triggered. People traveling in the mountains should practice caution and avoid steep hills and wind slabs.
travelAdvisory.highlights: The snowpack is currently unstable in all regions due to ongoing snowdrift in NE-winds. Weak layers have been detected in the snowpack widely and slabs have released

weatherForecast.highlights: Dregur smám saman úr vindi á morgun, þriðjudag. Hægviðri og úrkomulaust á miðvikudag. Hiti fer upp fyrir frostmark á láglendi yfir daginn næstu daga.

avalancheActivity.comment: Today, Monday, a small avalanche fell on the road in Hestfjörður in Ísafjarðardjúp. On Saturday a few avalanches released in Önundarfjörður and one on Friday. Many avalanches fell in the area in the snowstorms the week before last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Windslabs have formed in NE-snowdrift and snowshowers over the last few days. A few avalanches have released recently. Weak layers may prevail in cold and calm weather over the next days.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snowstorms in NE and N winds added a lot of snow in the week before last week. There has been no thaw since then and thick windslabs are in gullies and leeside of mountains. The older windslabs are considered rather stable in most places, but if they would release the avalanches might be big. During the last week new snow has been added in NE-winds and this snow is considered unstable. Week layers may prevail in cold and calm weather over the next days.

travelAdvisory.comment: Heavy snowdrift in strong NE-winds many places the last days and alot of snow added at higher elevations in the Eastfjords and invalley in the northern part. Wind slabs are unstable many places and avalanches have released the last days. Today a slab overran the main road in Hestfjörður in Ísafjarðardjúp and a small slab was triggered by skiers in Böggvisstaðafjall above Dalvík. weatherForecast.highlights: Það dregur úr vindi og éljagangi aðfaranótt þriðjudags 2. apríl, og spáð er úrkomulausu hægviðri á miðvikudag. Áfram verður kalt í veðri.

avalancheActivity.comment: Several slabs were released in the blizzard on Eastern day and a small slab was triggered by skiers the april 1st. A large avalanche in Héðinsfjörður was remotely trigger by snowmobiles on March 26th. Many slabs released in strong N-winds a week ago, some of them were big
avalancheActivity.highlights: A lot of new snow inland in strong NE-winds last days, windslabs in most aspects. Total blizzard for a while on Eastern day, strong NNE-wind with heavy precip for a while and several slabs released

snowpackStructure.highlights: A lot of new snow in the mountains after northerly blizzard a week ago resulting in many slab avalanches some were quite big. Total Blizzard for a while on Eastern day, strong NNE-wind with heavy precip for a while and great snowdrift, snowshowers since then. Snowpit (Illviðrishnjúkur 26.03) showed new snow and windslab on old crust. Bond between new and old snow was rather weak with CT12. Two other snowpits from last few days showed a rather weak bond between windslab and old snow, with faceted snow and depth hoar between layers.

weatherForecast.highlights: Stíf NA-átt og él í fyrstu en hægari A-lægari átt og úrkomulítið á þriðjud. Hæg breytileg átt áfram og frost

avalancheActivity.comment: The visibility has not been good, but one avalanche has been spotted to day in inner part of Eskifjörður. A few smaller avalanches released over a week ago
avalancheActivity.highlights: Alot of new snow in the mountains the last days in NE-winds and snowshowers. Layered windslabs could be sensetive, especially on southerly aspects. People travelling in steep terrain might trigger slab avalanches

snowpackStructure.highlights: Quite alot of new snow in the mountains. Wind slabs are present after snowfall in strong NE-winds the last days. The snowpack is likely layered in most places and very sensetive slabs have been observed in snowpits. A pwl was also found in the older snow at high elevation

weatherForecast.highlights: Áframhaldandi él aðfaranótt þriðjudags með einhverjum skafrenningi. Lægir á þriðjudag og á miðvikudag verður áfram hægviðri og úrkomulaust.
